ORDINANCE NO. 2019-O-028
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE MUNICIPAL CODE OF THE
VILLAGE OF MOKENA, ILLINOIS AS ADOPTED BY
ORDINANCE NO. 960 ON JULY 25, 1983 AS IT PERTAINS TO
TITLE 9 (VILLAGE OF MOKENA, ZONING ORDINANCE)
WHEREAS, the Village of Mokena has recently reviewed certain terms within its Zoning
Ordinance; and
WHEREAS, the Village of Mokena has determined that the Zoning Ordinance requires certain
amendments and revisions within Chapter 16- Off-Street Parking and Loading, and Chapter 20 –
Definitions; and,
WHEREAS, the Planning Commission, after due notice by publication, held a Public Hearing on
July 18, 2019, to hear testimony and discuss the proposed text amendment; and,
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 2/714
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF
THE VILLAGE OF MOKENA, WILL COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
Section 1: That Title 9 (Zoning), Chapter 16 (Off-Street Parking and Loading), Section 9-
16A-2(H) (General Requirements) is hereby amended to insert new Subsection “H” as follows, and to reletter
the remaining subsections:
H. It shall be unlawful to park a semi-truck tractor unit or semi-truck trailer on a residentially-zoned
property.
Section 2: That Title 9 (Zoning), Chapter 20 (Definitions), Section 9-20-3 (Definitions) shall
be amended to insert the following new definition in the appropriate alphabetical order:
Semi-truck,The combination of a tractor unit and one or more trailers.
Section 3: That all Ordinances or parts of Ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby
repealed.
Section 4: That this Ordinance shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and
publication, in accordance with applicable law.
ADOPTED this 26th day of August 2019, by the Board of Trustees of the Village of Mokena, Will
County, Illinois.

ORDINANCE NO. 2019-O-034
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE MUNICIPAL CODE
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 5/714
OF THE VILLAGE OF MOKENA
PROHIBITING CANNABIS BUSINESS ESTABLISHMENTS
WHEREAS, the Village of Mokena has the authority to adopt ordinances and to promulgate rules and
regulations that protect the public health, safety and welfare of its citizens; and
WHEREAS, this Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the provisions of the Illinois Cannabis Regulation and
Tax Act, Public Act 101-0027, which provides that the Village of Mokena has the authority to prohibit
adult-use cannabis business establishments; and
WHEREAS, the Village of Mokena has determined that the operation of cannabis business
establishments would present adverse impacts upon the health, safety and welfare of the residents, and
additional costs, burdens and impacts upon law enforcement and regulatory operations of the Village;
and
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED by the Board of Trustees of the Village of Mokena as follows:
SECTION 1. Recitals. The facts and statements contained in the preamble to this Ordinance are found
to be true and correct and are hereby adopted as part of this Ordinance.
SECTION 2. Cannabis Business Establishments Prohibited. Title 3 – Business and License
Regulations of the Municipal Code of the Village of Mokena shall be amended by the addition of Chapter
19 that will read as follows:
Title 3, Chapter 19- Cannabis Business Establishments Prohibited.
1. Definitions. The following words and phrases shall, for the purposes of this Chapter, have the
meanings respectively ascribed to them by this section, as follows:
ADULT-USE CANNABIS BUSINESS ESTABLISHMENT: A cultivation center, craft grower, processing
organization, infuser organization, dispensing organization or transporting organization.
ADULT-USE CANNABIS CRAFT GROWER: A facility operated by an organization or business that is
licensed by the Illinois Department of Agriculture to cultivate, dry, cure and package cannabis and
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 6/714
perform other necessary activities to make cannabis available for sale at a dispensing organization or
use at a processing organization, per the Cannabis Regulation and Tax Act, (P.A.101-0027), as it may be
amended from time-to-time, and regulations promulgated thereunder.
ADULT-USE CANNABIS CULTIVATION CENTER: A facility operated by an organization or business that
is licensed by the Illinois Department of Agriculture to cultivate, process, transport and perform necessary
activities to provide cannabis and cannabis-infused products to licensed cannabis business
establishments, per the Cannabis Regulation and Tax Act, (P.A.101-0027), as it may be amended from
time-to-time, and regulations promulgated thereunder.
ADULT-USE CANNABIS DISPENSING ORGANIZATION: A facility operated by an organization or
business that is licensed by the Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation to acquire
cannabis from licensed cannabis business establishments for the purpose of selling or dispensing
cannabis, cannabis-infused products, cannabis seeds, paraphernalia or related supplies to purchasers or
to qualified registered medical cannabis patients and caregivers, per the Cannabis Regulation and Tax
Act, (P.A.101-0027), as it may be amended from time-to-time, and regulations promulgated thereunder.
ADULT-USE CANNABIS INFUSER ORGANIZATION OR INFUSER: A facility operated by an
organization or business that is licensed by the Illinois Department of Agriculture to directly incorporate
cannabis or cannabis concentrate into a product formulation to produce a cannabis-infused product, per
the Cannabis Regulation and Tax Act, (P.A.101-0027), as it may be amended from time-to-time, and
regulations promulgated thereunder.
ADULT-USE CANNABIS PROCESSING ORGANIZATION OR PROCESSOR: A facility operated by an
organization or business that is licensed by the Illinois Department of Agriculture to either extract
constituent chemicals or compounds to produce cannabis concentrate or incorporate cannabis or
cannabis concentrate into a product formulation to produce a cannabis product, per the Cannabis
Regulation and Tax Act, (P.A.101-0027), as it may be amended from time-to-time, and regulations
promulgated thereunder.
ADULT-USE CANNABIS TRANSPORTING ORGANIZATION OR TRANSPORTER:
An organization or business that is licensed by the Illinois Department of Agriculture to transport
cannabis on behalf of a cannabis business establishment or a community college licensed under the
Community College Cannabis Vocational Training Pilot Program, per the Cannabis Regulation and Tax
Act, (P.A.101-0027), as it may be amended from time-to-time, and regulations promulgated thereunder.
PERSON: Any person, firm, corporation, association, club, society or other organization, including any
owner, manager, proprietor, employee, volunteer or agent.
2. Cannabis Business Establishments Prohibited. The following Adult-Use Cannabis Business
Establishments are prohibited in the Village of Mokena. No person shall locate, operate, own, suffer,
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 7/714
allow to be operated or aide, abet or assist in the operation within the Village of Mokena of any of the
following:
Adult-Use Cannabis Craft Grower
Adult-Use Cannabis Cultivation Center
Adult-Use Cannabis Dispensing Organization
Adult-Use Cannabis Infuser Organization or Infuser
Adult-Use Cannabis Processing Organization or Processor
Adult-Use Cannabis Transporting Organization or Transporter
3. Public Nuisance Declared. Operation of any prohibited Cannabis Business Establishment within the
Village in violation of the provisions of Title 3, Chapter 19 is hereby declared a public nuisance and shall
be abated pursuant to all available remedies.
4. Violations. Violations of this Article may be enforced in accordance with the provisions of Title 1,
Chapter 13 of this Code.
5. Severability. If any provision of this Ordinance, or the application of any provision of this Ordinance, is
held unconstitutional or otherwise invalid, such occurrence shall not affect other provisions of this
Ordinance, or their application, that can be given effect without the unconstitutional or invalid provision or
its application. Each unconstitutional or invalid provision, or application of such provision, is severable,
unless otherwise provided by this Ordinance.
6. Effective Date. This Ordinance shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval
and publication as required by law.
ADOPTED THIS 14th day of October 2019.
AYES:
NAYS:
ABSENT:
APPROVED THIS 14th day of October 2019.
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 8/714

ORDINANCE NO. 2019-O-035
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE ANIMAL CONTROL ORDINANCE
WITHIN THE VILLAGE OF MOKENA, WILL COUNTY, ILLINOIS
WHEREAS, Title 5 of the Village of Mokena Code of Ordinances establishes certain animal
control regulations in the Village of Mokena; and
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 9/714
WHEREAS, the Village of Mokena has entered into an Intergovernmental Agreement with Will
County regarding said regulations; and
WHEREAS, the Village of Mokena has determined that specific provisions of the said Ordinance should be
amended with respect to sections regarding Will County; and
WHEREAS, it is in the best interests of said to amend the relevant sections of Title 5, Chapter 3 regarding
Animal Control.
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF MOKENA, WILL COUNTY, ILLINOIS, as follows:
SECTION 1: Text Amendments
A. Section 5-3-1 of the Village of Mokena Code of Ordinances shall be
amended as follows:
DEFINITIONS:
ANIMAL: Every living creature, other than man, which may be affected by rabies.
ANIMAL CONTROL
OFFICER: The employee(s) or designee(s) of the Village of Mokena including the Will County
animal control officer, authorized to exercise policing powers in the enforcement of this
chapter and animal control laws of Illinois.
AT LARGE: Animals not confined or otherwise restrained or controlled in an enclosure or by leash or
lead.
CAT (FELIS CATUS): Includes all members of the feline family.
CONFINED: Restriction of an animal at all times by the owner, or his agent, to an escape proof building
or other enclosure away from other animals and the public.
CONTROL: Any animal that is secured and restrained by a leash of sufficient strength not more than
six feet (6’) in length, or within the premises of its owner, or confined within a crate or
cage.
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 10/714
DANGEROUS DOG: A. Any individual dog anywhere other than upon the property of the owner or custodian
of the dog and unmuzzled, unleashed, or unattended by its owner or custodian that
behaves in a manner that a reasonable person would believe poses a serious and
unjustified imminent threat of serious physical injury or death to a person or a
companion animal or
B. A dog that, without justification, bites a person and does not cause serious physical
injury or attacks a companion animal and causes physical injury or death.
DOG (CANIDAE): All members of the canine family.
ENCLOSURE: A fence or structure of at least six feet (6’) in height, forming or causing an enclosure
suitable to prevent the entry of young children, and suitable to confine a vicious dog in
conjunction with other measures that may be enforced by the animal control officer.
Such enclosure shall be securely closed and locked and designed with secure sides, top,
and bottom and shall be designed to prevent the animal from escaping from the
enclosure. If the enclosure is a room within a residence, it cannot have direct ingress
from or egress to the outdoors unless it leads directly to an enclosed pen and the door
must be locked. A vicious dog may be allowed to move freely within the entire
residence if it is muzzled at all times.
ESCAPE PROOF
BUILDING OR OTHER
ENCLOSURE: A building or other enclosure of such strength and structure to keep the confined animal
away from other animals and the public.
EXCREMENT CONTROL: The immediate removal and sanitary disposal or animal excrement from any property,
public or private, including property of the owner.
WILL COUNTY PET
ID TAGS: Tags issues by Will County on the County’s behalf upon the owner’s application which
includes a current certification from a State of Illinois licensed veterinarian that the
animal has been fully and currently inoculated against rabies and otherwise poses no
medical condition which would affect human beings or other animals.
GUARD DOG: A dog used in a commercial business for the purposes of patrol and protection security.
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 11/714
GUIDE DOG: A dog trained by a recognized organization to lead the legally blind, the hearing impaired
or support dogs for a physically handicapped person.
HAS BEEN BITTEN
OR BITE: Has been seized with the teeth or jaws, so that the person or animal seized has been
nipped, gripped or has been wounded or pierced and further includes contact of saliva
with any break or abrasion of skin, or mucous membrane.
HOME CONFINEMENT: The animal must be kept within the house where the owner, caretaker, or harborer is
residing. If outside, the animal must remain on the property of the owner and kept on a
six foot (6’) leash or monitored within a secure enclosure.
IMPOUNDED: Taken into custody by the animal control department or law enforcement agency and
placed in an animal control facility/shelter or veterinarian hospital/clinic under the
control of the animal control officer.
INOCULATION
AGAINST RABIES: The injection of a rabies vaccine approved by the Illinois Department of Agriculture and
administered by a veterinarian licensed by the State of Illinois in accordance with the
vaccination manufacturer’s recommendations for its use.
INTACT ANIMAL: An animal that has not been spayed or neutered.
LEASH AND/OR
LEAD: A cord, rope, strap, cable, or chain, which shall be securely fastened to the collar or
harness of a dog or other animal and shall be of sufficient strength to keep such dog or
other animal under control.
LICENSED
VETERINARIAN: A veterinarian licensed by the State of Illinois who engages in the practice of veterinary
medicine.
NUISANCE: Any animal(s) which runs at large, damages private or public property or barks, whines, or
howls in an excessive, continuous, or untimely manner.
OWNER: Any person having a right of property in a dog, cat, or other animal, or who keeps,
maintains, possesses, or harbors an animal, or who has it in his/her care, or acts as its
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 12/714
custodian, or who knowingly permits an animal to remain on any premises occupied by
him or her.
PARCEL: Any legally recorded piece of land.
PERSON: Any individual, firm, corporation, partnership, society, association or other legal entity,
any public or private institution, the State of Illinois, municipal corporation or political
subdivision of the State, or any other business unit.
PHYSICAL INJURY: The impairment of physical condition.
POLICE DOG: A dog owned or used by a law enforcement department or agency in the course of the
department or agency’s work.
POUND: Any facility approved by the animal control officer for the purpose of enforcing this
chapter and used as a shelter for seized stray, homeless and abandoned animals.
RUN LINE: A system of tying a dog with a collar and clasp of sufficient strength in a place with either
a rope, cable or chain having a tensile strength sufficient to fully restrain and control the
dog and so located that the dog is on the owner’s private property and it is as least three
feet (3’) from the adjoining property or any public property.
RUNNING AT LARGE: Those animals which are not under “control” or “confined” as defined herein.
SEIZE: To enter upon public or private property, for the purpose of impounding any dog, cat, or
other animal considered by the animal control officer to be in violation of this chapter.
SERIOUS PHYSICAL
INJURY: A physical injury that creates a substantial risk of death or that causes death, serious
disfigurement, protracted impairment of health, impairment of function of any bodily
organ, or plastic surgery.
STRAYING: A dog, cat or other animal not on the premises of the owner or not controlled or confined
as set forth in this chapter.
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 13/714
VICIOUS DOG: A dog that, without justification, attacks a person and causes serious physical injury or
death or any individual dog that has been found to be a “dangerous dog” upon three (3)
separate occasions.
B. Section 5-3-2 of the Village of Mokena Code of Ordinances shall be amended as follows:
CRUELTY TO ANIMALS:
A. Each owner shall provide for each of his animals:
1. Sufficient quantity of good quality, wholesome food and water;
2. Adequate shelter and protection from the weather;
3. Veterinary care when needed to prevent suffering; and
4. Humane care and treatment.
B. No owner or person may beat, cruelly treat, torment, starve, overwork or otherwise abuse any
animal.
C. No owner may abandon any animal where it may become public charge or may suffer injury,
hunger or exposure.
D. No owner or person shall confine any animal in a motor vehicle or enclosure in such a manner that
places it in a life or health threatening situation by exposure to a prolonged period of extreme heat or
cold. In order to protect the health and safety of the animal, a law enforcement officer or animal
control officer who has probable cause to believe that this section is being violated shall have
authority to enter such motor vehicle by a reasonable means, after making a reasonable effort, if
time permits, to locate the owner or person.
C. Section 5-3-3 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as follows:
DISEASED ANIMALS: The owner of an animal afflicted with a contagious disease or an infection
disease shall not permit such animal to run at large, or to be exposed in any public place or on private
property whereby the health of a person or other animal may be affected, nor shall such diseased animal
be shipped or removed from the premises of the owner thereof except under the supervision of the
animal control officer. If directed by the animal control officer, the owner shall cause to secure the
disposition of any diseased animal and such treatment of affected premises as to prevent the
communication or spread of contagion or infection.
D. Section 5-3-4 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as follows:
DISTURBING THE PEACE: It shall be unlawful to harbor or keep any animal, which disturbs the
peace by loud noises at any time of the day or night. No owner shall allow a dog to bark, howl or whine
in an excessive, continuous or untimely manner.
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 14/714
E. Section 5-3-5 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as follows:
RUNNING AT LARGE: It shall be unlawful to permit any animal to run at large in any public place in
the Village at any time. Dogs and cats which are on any street, sidewalk, alley, parkway, or any other
public places or private property excluding the property of the owner without being held securely on a
leash shall be deemed to be running at large. Additionally, any animal found running at large in
violation of this section may be apprehended and impounded. Any dog found running at large contrary
to the provisions of this act a second or subsequent time must be spayed or neutered at the expense of
the owner within thirty (30) days after being reclaimed unless already spayed or neutered; failure to
comply shall result in impoundment.
F. Section 5-3-6 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as follows:
HOUSING ANIMALS: No person shall cause or allow any stable or place where any animal is or may
be kept to become unclean or unwholesome.
G. Section 5-3-7 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as
follows:
ANIMAL EXCREMENT:
A. It shall be unlawful for the owner of any animal to maintain a public nuisance by permitting or
allowing such animal to discharge excrement upon any public or private property within the Village,
other than upon the animal owner’s private property, without immediately thereafter removing or
cleaning up said excrement from such public or private property. This provision does not apply to any
person who is handicapped and is utilizing a seeing eye dog.
B. No owner of any animal shall allow excrement to accumulate in any yard, pen, or premises in or
upon which animal shall be confined or kept to the extent that it creates a public nuisance.
H. Section 5-3-8 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as
follows:
INOCULATION AGAINST RABIES: Every owner of a dog, cat or ferret four (4) months of age or
older, kept, maintained, possessed or harbored within the Village shall cause said dog, cat or ferret to be
inoculated against rabies by a licensed veterinarian once each year, or such extended effective period of
the vaccination as allowed by law, and shall maintain evidence of such current vaccination.
I. Section 5-3-9 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 15/714
follows:
ANIMAL BITES OR ABRASIONS: All animal (domestic or wildlife) to human bites or abrasions
and all animal to animal bites or abrasions are required to be reported to the Mokena police department.
A copy of all animal (domestic or wildlife) to human bite or abrasion reports will be forwarded to Will
County animal control. A copy of all animal to animal bite or abrasion reports will be forwarded to Will
County animal control.
J. Section 5-3-10 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as
follows:
A. Dangerous Dog:
1. In order to have a dog deemed “dangerous,” the animal control officer or sworn law
enforcement officer must give notice of the infraction that is the basis of the investigation to
the owner, conduct an investigation, and issue a written report to deem a dog to be
“dangerous.” The determination, which shall also include a complete description of the
appeal process, shall be transmitted by mail or personally served to the owner. No dog shall
be deemed a “dangerous dog” unless shown to be a dangerous dog by a preponderance of
the evidence. A dog shall not be declared dangerous if it is determined the conduct of the
dog was justified because:
a)The threat was sustained by a person who at the time was committing a crime or
offense upon the owner or custodian of the dog or was committing a willful trespass
or other tort upon the premises or property occupied by the owner of the animal;
b) The threatened person was abusing, assaulting, or physically threatening the dog
or its offspring;
c)The injured, threatened, or killed companion animal was attacking or threatening to
attack the dog or its offspring; or
d) The dog was responding to pain or injury or was protecting itself, its owner,
custodian, or a member of its household, kennel, or offspring.
2. If a dog is deemed dangerous, the animal control officer or chief of police shall order the
dog to be spayed or neutered and microchipped, if not already within fourteen (14) days at
the owner’s sole cost and expense, and may order one or more of the following as deemed
appropriate under the circumstances and necessary for the protection of the public:
a)That said animal shall be kept within an area fenced by a fence six feet (6’) in height,
and all gates within said fence shall be locked at all times or on a run line when not
confined in the owner’s home.
b) That said animal shall be under the direct control of an adult, eighteen (18) years
of age or older, by the use of a leash or lead not more than six feet (6’) in length
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 16/714
whenever the animal is not confined or controlled on the owner’s property.
c)The chief of police or animal control officer may also order a dangerous dog to be
muzzled whenever it is not confined or controlled on the owner’s property in a
manner that will prevent it from biting any person or animal, but that shall not injure
the dog or interfere with its vision or respiration.
B. Vicious Dog:
1. In order to have a dog deemed “vicious,” the animal control officer or sworn law
enforcement officer must give notice of the infraction that is the basis of the investigation to
the owner, conduct an investigation, and present a written report recommending a finding
that the dog is a vicious dog to the Village attorney and owner. The Village attorney, or any
citizen of the Village in which the dog exists may file a complaint or suitable pleading in the
circuit court in the name of the Village to deem a dog to be a vicious dog. The animal
control officer shall determine in the interim if and where the animal shall be confined
during the pendency of the case. The animal control officer’s determination shall be final
pending an order of the court. A dog may not be declared “vicious” if the court determines
that the conduct of the dog was justified because:
a)The threat, injury, or death was sustained by a person who at the time was
committing a crime or offense upon the owner or custodian of the dog, or was
committing a willful trespass or other tort upon the premises or property occupied by
the owner of the animal;
b) The injured, threatened, or killed person was abusing, assaulting, or physically
threatening the dog or its offspring, or has in the past abused, assaulted, or physically
threatened the dog or its offspring; or
c)The dog was responding to pain or injury or was protecting itself, its owner,
custodian, or member of its household, kennel, or offspring.
If the burden of proof has been met, and the court so determines, the dog shall be
deemed to be a vicious dog. If the court finds that a vicious dog should not be
destroyed, the dog shall be spayed or neutered and microchipped, at the expense of
the owner, within ten (10) days of the finding. A dog found to be a vicious dog shall
not be released to the owner until the chief of police or animal control officer
approved of the enclosure in which the dog shall be kept pursuant to subsection B2
of this section. No owner or keeper of a vicious dog shall sell or give away the dog
without approval of the chief of police, animal control officer or the court.
2. It shall be unlawful for any person to keep or maintain any dog which has been found to be
a vicious dog unless the dog is kept in an enclosure. The only times that a vicious dog may
be allowed out of the enclosure are : 1) if it is necessary for the owner or keeper to obtain
veterinary care for the dog, 2) in case of an emergency or natural disaster where the dog’s
life is threatened, or 3) to comply with the order of a court of competent jurisdiction,
provided that the dog is securely muzzled and restrained with a leash not exceeding three
feet (3’) in length, and shall be under the direct control and supervision of the owner or
keeper of the vicious dog or muzzled in its residence.
C. Exemption: Guide dogs for the blind or hearing impaired, support dogs for the physically
handicapped and guard or police owned dogs are exempt from this section; provided an attack or
injury to a person occurs while the dog is performing duties as expected. To qualify for exemption
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 17/714
under this section, each such dog shall be currently inoculated against rabies in accordance with the
law of the State and any other applicable law. It shall be the duty of the owner of such exempted dog
to notify the chief of police or animal control officer of changes of address. In the case of a guard
dog, the owner shall keep the police and fire departments advised of the location where such dog
will be stationed.
K. Section 5-3-11 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as
follows:
IMPOUNDING REGULATIONS:
A. Any dog, cat, or other animal running at large shall be seized and impounded by the Mokena police
or animal control officer. Upon receiving any dog, cat or other animal, the animal control officer
shall immediately make a complete registry as may be required by law and shall make a reasonable
attempt to locate and notify the owner that said animal has been seized and is impounded awaiting
redemption. Redemption shall be in accordance with regulations adopted by the Will County animal
control officer.
B. Any dog, cat, or other animal impounded under the provisions of this chapter and not redeemed by
its owner within seven (7) days of its impoundment, is herein declared to be property of Will County
and may be disposed of at the discretion of the Will County animal control officer. Any costs of
such impoundment and disposal shall be the obligation of the owner, if found.
L. Section 5-3-12 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as
follows:
LICENSING (WILL COUNTY PET ID TAGS): The owner of a dog and/or cat residing in the
Village shall register and obtain a Will County pet ID tag annually for each pet through the Village or
Will County office.
M. Section 5-3-13 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as
follows:
RIGHT OF ENTRY FOR INSPECTIONS, APPREHENSION OF DOGS, CATS OR OTHER
ANIMALS: For the purpose of carrying out the provisions of this chapter, the Mokena police and/or
animal control officer shall be authorized to enter upon private premises to apprehend a stray dog or
12/18/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=1090 18/714
other animal, a dangerous/vicious dog or other animal or a dog or other animal thought to be infected
with rabies.
N. Section 5-3-14 of the Village Code of Ordinances shall be amended as
follows:
ENFORCEMENT; EXEMPTION FROM LIABILITY: The Village, its animal control officer, the
Village’s designees and other persons authorized to enforce the provisions of this chapter shall not be
held liable for the injury, death, or disease which may occur to any dog, cat or other animal as a
consequence of the enforcement of this chapter.
SECTION 2: That all Ordinances or parts of Ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby
repealed.
SECTION3: That this Ordinance shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval as
provided by law.
ADOPTED this 28th day of October, 2019, by the Board of Trustees of the Village of Mokena, Will County,
Illinois.
